answers.answer: 120/80 is normal, 140/90 is high normal or boarderline.  Talk to your doctor but if he's concerned about preeclampsia he might try you on blood pressure meds. Try not to stress, if you aren't having any swelling and generally feeling fine then try not to worry and talk to you doctor.
Epsom salt baths 3x a week can help it.

I had preeclampsia with my first pregnancy. I wasn't made aware until I gave birth and my BP skyrocketed to 200/100. I was neglected by my doctor and by his office. I was just curious as to what some doctors do. I am now going for weekly appointments instead of every 2 weeks. Preeclampsia is once again on the table as a possibility.

My nurse never tells me what my blood pressure is but last time i went i saw that the bottom number was 90. My dr never mentioned it to me but i feel like that is really high. Im 21 weeks and high blood pressure runs in my family. Im just waiting for him to suggest something for me to do or take.
120 over 80 is normal. In the regular world they don't consider your blood pressure High or even borderline until you are 140 over 95. I'm really not sure if it differs in pregnancy though

mines was 140/90 and for my size thats high but the my protein in my urine was low. my doctor had me draw blood and collect urine for 24 hours and the protien was at 100. your doctor should have wrote a prescription for you to do that. it may not be a problem for you.

My bp was 140/90 they said i may have preeclamsia and send me to do blood work and collect 24 hr hurine. The results come up fine and they said i was ok i think as long as you do not have proteine in the urine you are fine

question: Before your doctor considered preeclampsia? What efforts did they make to lower it? How many weeks were you? And what was the outcome? I'm 30w4d and this is my second appointment in 3 weeks that my blood pressure has been in the 140's. Its usually around 110-128.
title: How high was your blood pressure...
